ExpressRoute

Dedicated private network fiber connections to Azure

Apply for 1RMB Trial Buy Now

ExpressRoute is a service that enables you to create a proprietary connection between the Azure Data Center and your on-premises or co-located infrastructure. ExpressRoute connections do not bypass the public Internet, and are more reliable, faster, and more secure, with shorter latency compared with typical connections over the Internet.

The proprietary connection between the ExpressRoute service and Azure can be established through the ExpressRoute connection service provider. Customers can choose a pricing plan based on their own needs: an unlimited data plan or a metered data plan. The costs associated with these two plans are different. The cost of 2 ports (on 2 routers) is included in the monthly price to provide redundancy.

ExpressRoute Premium Edition Add-on

ExpressRoute Premium Edition is an add-on for the ExpressRoute Unlimited Data Plan/Metered Data Plan. Customers will be able to get more routing tables and support from Azure, and use the Chinese Azure network to connect to different regions. The ExpressRoute Premium Edition add-on provides the following features:

  • The routing table limit for public and private counterparts has been increased from 4000 routes to 10,000 routes.
  • The number of VNets that can be connected to an ExpressRoute line has been increased (the default value is 10).
  • Connect northern China and eastern China through the Azure Core Network. You can now use a regional ExpressRoute line to link VNets in another region. Example: you can link a VNet created in northern China to an ExpressRoute line created in eastern China.

For more details, please refer to the ExpressRoute Service Documentation page.

FAQ

Expand All
  • What data centers in China can the ExpressRoute physical line be used?

    The ExpressRoute physical line still need to be connected to China east and China north.

  • Which regions correspond to CN Zone 1 and CN Zone 2?

    The sub-region is the lowest level of geographical location that you can choose to deploy apps and affiliated data to. For ExpressRoute, CN Zone 1 and CN Zone 2 correspond to the regions below.

    • CN Zone 1 – China East and China North;
    • CN Zone 2 – China East 2 and China North 3.
  • What additional fees will other parties charge me for in this solution?

    The ExpressRoute connection service provider will charge you extra fees. Please contact your network connection service provider for pricing information.

  • How many ports are included in the monthly fee for ExpressRoute?

    For the purpose of redundancy, 2 ports are included in the monthly fee as shown (on 2 routers).

  • If I connect to one of China's ExpressRoute locations (such as Eastern China), can I access other areas in China via ExpressRoute?

    Yes. After connecting to one of China's ExpressRoute locations (such as Eastern China), you can purchase ExpressRoute's Premium services (to be launched in the near future) to access other regions in China via ExpressRoute.

  • Can I connect to any Azure region from a given ExpressRoute location?

    No. ExpressRoute in China can only be connected to regions within China. You cannot access Azure services in other countries through ExpressRoute in China.

  • Can I set up multiple lines in my account? If so, what do I need to do?

    If you are using Azure based on an Enterprise agreement with 21Vianet, please contact our data setup team to ensure correct setup.

  • If I use ExpressRoute during a certain period of a month, will I be charged at a different rate?

    If your ExpressRoute service is valid for the entire month, you will be charged at the monthly rate, regardless of how you use it. However, if you cancel the ExpressRoute service during the month, you will only be charged for the port charges for the hours of service you used, as well as the cost of the data transfer that occurred during the month in which the service was cancelled.

  • When does the billing for ExpressRoute start and stop?

    The ExpressRoute fee will begin to be calculated upon the issuance of the service key to the customer, and the charge will cease after the following conditions: (1) The customer requests a line to be deleted, (2) The ExpressRoute connection provider has cancelled the line.

  • Can I change the port speed during a month?

    Yes, you can change the port speed at any time. However, up to 24 hours of downtime may occur when you demand the change.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support to select self-service or any other methods to contact us for support.

We guarantee at least 99.9% availability of ExpressRoute private lines. To learn more about the details of our server level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.
